intro: Hieracium neopolytrichum, commonly known as the tall hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in late summer, and it is often found in meadows and disturbed soils. Hieracium neopolytrichum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
